title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman urges younger Red Sox players to focus on execution as Boston clings to a wildcard spot.
The Red Sox are currently 81-68, holding the American League's second wildcard position before their final 13 games.
Bregman emphasizes simplicity and patience, hitting his first home run since August in a recent game against the Yankees.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution drew 1-1 with Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium, with Luca Langoni scoring a late equalizer.
Despite the draw, New England remains in 11th place, narrowly avoiding playoff elimination as Chicago lost to NYCFC.
Eighteen-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, impressing with his composure and passing in midfield.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora urges caution, hesitant to discuss Red Sox playoff prospects despite holding a wild-card spot.
Red Sox currently hold second wild card in AL, trailing Yankees by 1.5 games and leading Rangers by 3.
Red Sox facing lineup adjustments against left-handed pitchers, with injuries impacting player availability.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox chief baseball officer, is seeking a new general manager for the offseason.
The Red Sox have had a vacant GM position since Breslow's 2024 appointment, with reduced GM influence recently.
Five assistant general managers, including Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, are potential candidates for the GM role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick in exchange.
Polk, a 2024 second-round draft pick, had 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns in his rookie season.
Patriots will send a 2028 seventh-round pick to the Saints, reducing the 2024 draft class to two remaining players.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots aim to end their five-game losing streak in Miami as they face the Dolphins in Week 2.
Dolphins' quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is undefeated in seven starts against the Patriots since being drafted in 2020.
Miami's defense struggles with secondary departures but features strong pass rushers like Bradley Chubb and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, showcasing her Southern Gothic narrative.
Cain's setlist included songs from her albums 'Preacher’s Daughter' and 'Willoughby Tucker, I’ll Always Love You'.
The concert featured special visuals and a guest appearance by Jae Matthews from Boy Harsher.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior', a true story about redemption in college football.
The film directed by Rod Lurie will have a Boston pre-release screening on September 14 with Chiklis attending.
Chiklis, a Lowell native and Emmy winner, returns to tackle football on screen for the first time since 1980.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are on the Forbes list of the 400 richest Americans, with net worths ranging up to $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson, CEO of Fidelity Investments, leads the Massachusetts list at 27th with a net worth increase to $35 billion.
The list's wealthiest Massachusetts individuals include Robert Kraft, with $13.8 billion, and the Johnson family members of Fidelity fame.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox managed only two hits in a 4-1 loss to the Yankees at Fenway Park.
Boston's offense struggled without key players, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
The Red Sox committed three errors, contributing to the Yankees' victory and highlighting defensive lapses.
